definitions: being distinct or separate from the one mentioned or implied
being the remaining ones in a group beyond those already mentioned
examples: I prefer the other restaurant across the street
She chose the other option after careful consideration
Do you have any other questions about the project
The other students arrived after the bell rang

definitions: having the qualities that are desirable or distinguishing in a particular thing
conforming to moral standards of what is right and just
giving pleasure, enjoyment, or satisfaction to the senses or mind
having the necessary skill, knowledge, or experience to do something well
examples: This restaurant serves really good food every day
She bought a good quality winter coat
Being honest is always a good thing to do
He's a good person who helps his neighbors
We had such a good time at the party
The weather was good for our picnic yesterday
She's really good at playing the violin professionally
He's a good driver with twenty years experience

definitions: recently brought into being, made, produced, or acquired for the first time
not previously known, experienced, or encountered by someone before now
examples: They just bought a new car last weekend
The company launched its new product line yesterday
Starting college was a completely new experience for her
He's trying to learn new skills for his career

definitions: of an extent, amount, or intensity considerably above the normal or average
of ability, quality, or eminence considerably above the normal or average
having significant importance, distinction, or consequence in a particular area
examples: They discovered a great canyon during their expedition
A great crowd gathered to watch the parade
She did a great job on her presentation today
That was a great movie we watched last night
Einstein was one of the great scientists of history
The great depression affected millions of American families

definitions: of considerable size, extent, or physical dimensions compared to others
having serious or important consequences, influence, or effect on something
examples: They live in a big house with ten rooms
The elephant is a big animal found in Africa
This is a big decision that will affect everyone
She got a big promotion at work yesterday

definitions: extending far upward from a base or having great vertical distance
great in quantity, degree, intensity, or force above normal levels
situated at or extending to a relatively great distance above ground
examples: The mountain peaks were extremely high above the valley
The building has very high ceilings throughout every room
Gas prices are unusually high this summer season nationwide
She has high expectations for her students' performance
The hawk flew high above the forest canopy
They built their house high on the hillside

definitions: having lived or existed for a relatively long period of time
belonging to or associated with the past rather than the present
examples: My grandmother is ninety years old this year
This old building was constructed in eighteen fifty
She still talks to her old friends from college
He sold his old car and bought a new one

definitions: failing to reach an acceptable standard of quality or performance
not conforming to standards of moral virtue or acceptable conduct
causing discomfort, unhappiness, or harm to someone or something involved
examples: The restaurant had really bad service last night
This milk smells bad and should be thrown away
Stealing from others is a very bad thing to do
He felt bad about lying to his parents
The storm caused bad damage to coastal homes
She's having a bad day at work today

definitions: not identical or alike in character, form, or quality when compared
separately distinguishable in nature, form, or quality from something else
examples: Each snowflake has a completely different pattern from others
Your approach is different from what we usually do
The twins have very different personalities despite looking alike
We need a different strategy to solve this problem

definitions: of, relating to, or characteristic of the United States or its inhabitants
having qualities or features typically associated with the people or culture of America
examples: The American flag has fifty stars and thirteen stripes
She studies American history at the university downtown
His American accent was noticeable when he spoke abroad
They serve traditional American food at that diner

definitions: small in size, amount, or degree compared to normal expectations
not much or barely any in quantity, extent, or duration
young or younger than usual, especially referring to children
examples: She lives in a little house near the park
The little bird sat on the window ledge
We have very little time before the deadline arrives
He knows little about advanced mathematics or physics
Her little brother just started kindergarten this year
When I was little, I loved playing outside

definitions: completely confident that one is right about something without doubt
able to be relied on or trusted to happen or behave as expected
examples: Are you sure this is the right address to go to
I'm sure she'll arrive on time for the meeting
This method is a sure way to solve the problem
He's a sure choice for team captain this year

definitions: of limited size, number, or extent compared to what is typical
relatively minor, insignificant, or trivial in importance or impact
examples: The small puppy could fit in her hands easily
They started with a small investment in the company
It's just a small problem that we can fix quickly
Don't worry about such small details right now

definitions: morally good, justified, or acceptable according to ethical standards
true or correct as a fact or in accordance with reality
on, toward, or relating to the side opposite to left
a moral or legal entitlement to have or do something
examples: Helping others is always the right thing to do
She made the right decision by telling the truth
Your answer to the math problem is absolutely right
Is this the right way to the train station
Turn right at the next traffic light intersection ahead
He writes with his right hand, not his left
Everyone has the right to express their opinions freely
Workers fought for their right to fair wages

definitions: of considerable or relatively great size, extent, or capacity
wide in range or scope, involving many people or things
examples: They need a large truck to move all their furniture
The large elephant walked slowly through the safari park
The company has a large influence on local economy
She has a large collection of vintage vinyl records

definitions: actually existing as a thing or occurring in fact, not imagined
not imitation or artificial but genuine and authentic in nature
used to emphasize the significance, seriousness, or extent of something
examples: Unicorns are mythical creatures, not real animals at all
Is this story based on real events or fiction
She wore real diamonds, not fake ones, to the gala
This jacket is made from real leather, not synthetic
The pandemic created real problems for small business owners
There's a real chance of rain this afternoon

definitions: of the most excellent, effective, or desirable type or quality
most advantageous, suitable, or advisable under the circumstances
examples: This is the best pizza restaurant in the entire city
She always gives her best effort in everything she does
Taking the highway is the best route during rush hour
It's best to arrive early for good seats

definitions: measuring a great distance from end to end in space
lasting or taking a great amount of time or duration
having a strong wish or desire for something over time
examples: The river is over two hundred miles long
She has beautiful long hair that reaches her waist
It was a long meeting that lasted four hours
They took a long vacation to Europe last summer
He had long hoped to visit his ancestral homeland
She longed for the peaceful days of her childhood

definitions: having lived or existed for only a short time, not old
having been made, started, or formed only recently or not long ago
examples: The young children played happily in the playground together
She's too young to drive a car legally
This is still a young company founded just last year
The young democracy faces many challenges ahead

definitions: of great significance or value likely to have profound effect on success
having high rank, status, or authority in a particular sphere or organization
examples: Good communication is important for any successful relationship
It's important to eat healthy foods and exercise regularly
She met with several important government officials yesterday
He's an important figure in the technology industry

definitions: being the sole one or ones with no others present or involved
with the negative result that nothing more than what is stated is true
examples: She's the only person who knows the secret password
This is the only solution to our current problem
It's only five dollars, so it's quite affordable
I was only trying to help you with the task

definitions: relating to or characteristic of a nation or its government as whole
extending throughout an entire nation rather than local or regional
examples: The national anthem plays before every baseball game here
They discussed national security issues at the meeting
The story made national news headlines this morning
It's become a national trend among young people

definitions: of the very darkest color owing to absence or absorption of light
relating to people with dark skin, especially of African origin
characterized by complete absence of light or visibility
examples: She wore a beautiful black dress to the formal event
The cat has shiny black fur that gleams in sunlight
Black history month is celebrated every February in America
She's a prominent black author and civil rights activist
The room was completely black when the power went out
They waited in the black night for dawn to arrive

definitions: relating to society or its organization and the way people live together
relating to activities in which people meet and interact with each other
examples: Social inequality remains a major problem in many countries
They studied the social impact of new technology
She's very social and enjoys meeting new people everywhere
We attended several social events during the conference

definitions: having the power, skill, means, or opportunity to do something
having considerable skill, proficiency, or intelligence in a particular area
examples: She was able to finish the project before deadline
Are you able to attend the meeting tomorrow morning
She's a very able manager who leads her team well
The able students completed the advanced coursework easily

definitions: relating to the government or public affairs of a country or area
relating to activities aimed at improving someone's status or increasing power within organization
examples: The political situation in the region remains very unstable
She studied political science at university for four years
His promotion was more political than based on merit
Office politics can make the workplace environment difficult

definitions: open to or accessible by all people in the community without restriction
relating to or provided by the government rather than private companies
done, perceived, or existing in open view of other people generally
examples: The public library offers free internet access to everyone
This beach is public property open year round
She works in public health for the city government
Public schools provide free education to all children
They made their relationship public on social media yesterday
He's not comfortable with public speaking at large events

definitions: of the color of milk or fresh snow due to reflection of light
relating to people with light-colored skin, especially of European descent
very pale in appearance, especially from illness, fear, or shock
examples: She painted the walls white to brighten the room
Fresh white snow covered the mountain peaks yesterday
The neighborhood was predominantly white middle-class families
White privilege is an important topic in social justice
His face turned white when he heard the bad news
She looked white as a sheet after the accident

definitions: of a more excellent or effective type or quality than others
more advantageous or suitable for a particular purpose or situation
partly or fully recovered from illness, injury, or mental stress
examples: This restaurant has better food than the one downtown
She's a better swimmer than her older brother
Taking the train would be better than driving there
It's better to apologize than to lose a friend
I'm feeling much better after resting all weekend
She's better now and can return to work

definitions: doing something or taking place after the expected or usual time
belonging to or taking place near the end of a particular period
having recently died or used to refer to someone who has died
examples: She arrived late to the important meeting this morning
The train is running twenty minutes late today
It happened in late December just before New Year
She worked late into the night finishing the report
Her late husband was a renowned scientist and professor
The late author's books continue to inspire readers

definitions: given or available without charge or payment to the recipient
not under the control or power of another person or authority
not occupied or in use and therefore available for someone
examples: The museum offers free admission every Sunday to residents
She got a free sample at the grocery store
After years of struggle, they were finally free from debt
The bird was set free from its cage yesterday
Are you free this weekend to help me move
This parking space is free if you need it

definitions: feeling distress, especially through sympathy with someone else's misfortune
feeling regret or penitence for one's own actions or situation
in a poor or pitiful state or condition deserving sympathy
examples: I'm sorry for breaking your favorite mug accidentally
She felt sorry about missing his birthday party
I'm so sorry to hear about your loss
We're sorry that you're going through this difficult time
The old building is in a sorry state of repair
His clothes were in a sorry condition after camping

definitions: situated not far above the ground, sea, or horizon level
below the usual or expected level, amount, or intensity
not loud or intense in volume, tone, or degree
examples: The plane flew low over the water during landing
She ducked under the low ceiling in the basement
Gas prices are at their lowest point this year
His test scores were disappointingly low this semester
Please speak in a low voice in the library
She turned the music to a low volume setting

definitions: relating to or characteristic of people or human beings in general
showing the better qualities of humankind such as kindness and compassion
examples: Human behavior is complex and difficult to predict accurately
The museum displays artifacts from early human civilizations
The volunteers showed great human kindness to disaster victims
It's only human to make mistakes sometimes in life

definitions: in accordance with fact or reality and not false or erroneous
loyal or faithful to a person, belief, or cause without wavering
accurately or exactly placed, formed, or positioned as intended
examples: Is it true that you're moving to another city
The story turned out to be true after investigation
She remained true to her principles despite pressure
He's been a true friend through difficult times
The wheel needs to be true for smooth riding
Make sure the picture frame is true to the wall

definitions: containing all the parts or elements without anything missing or excluded
not divided, broken, or damaged but in one complete piece
examples: She ate the whole pizza by herself last night
The whole class participated in the science fair project
The archaeologists found several whole pottery vessels intact
Swallow the pill whole with water, don't chew it

definitions: achieved without great effort or difficulty in accomplishing or understanding
free from worry, anxiety, or problems creating a relaxed state
examples: Learning to ride a bike is easy with practice
The test was surprisingly easy for most students
She has an easy life with few worries or stress
He has an easy manner that makes people comfortable

definitions: solid, firm, and resistant to pressure, force, or penetration
requiring great physical or mental effort to accomplish or understand
with a great deal of effort, energy, or force
examples: The ground was hard after weeks without any rain
This mattress is too hard for comfortable sleeping
Learning a new language is hard but very rewarding
The test was so hard that many students failed
She worked hard to achieve her goals this year
It's raining hard outside, better take an umbrella

definitions: happening or done before the usual or expected time occurs
belonging to or occurring near the beginning of a period
examples: She always arrives early to important meetings at work
The flowers bloomed early this year due to warm weather
Cave paintings show early human artistic expression
In the early days of the internet, connections were slow

definitions: able to happen or exist given the right circumstances or conditions
able to be done or achieved with available means or resources
examples: Is it possible to finish the project by Friday
Rain is possible this afternoon according to the forecast
We need to explore every possible solution to this problem
She did everything possible to help her friend succeed

definitions: not correct or true according to facts or accurate information
not conforming to accepted moral standards of what is right
not suitable, appropriate, or desirable for a particular situation
examples: Your answer to the math problem is completely wrong
I think you have the wrong phone number
Stealing is wrong no matter what the circumstances are
He knew it was wrong to lie to his parents
This is the wrong tool for this particular job
You're asking the wrong person about computer problems

definitions: containing or holding as much or as many as possible within limits
complete or containing all that is normal, expected, or possible
having eaten enough food to feel completely satisfied
examples: The parking lot was completely full by noon today
Pour water until the glass is full to the brim
Please write your full name on the application form
She told us the full story of what happened
I'm too full to eat dessert after that meal
The children were full after eating pizza and cake

definitions: relating to or occurring in a particular area, city, or town
belonging to or connected with the particular area where one lives
examples: Shop at local businesses to support the community economy
The local weather forecast predicts rain tomorrow afternoon
Ask a local resident for directions to the museum
She's a local who knows all the best restaurants

definitions: having the power to move heavy weights or perform physically demanding tasks
able to withstand great force or pressure without breaking or yielding
having a high degree of intensity, concentration, or effectiveness
examples: She needs to be strong to lift those heavy boxes
The athlete has very strong arms from years of training
This bridge is strong enough to support heavy trucks
We need strong rope that won't break under pressure
She has strong opinions about environmental protection issues
The coffee has a strong flavor that some people dislike

definitions: of high quality with very good or superior characteristics
consisting of very small particles or having very thin structure
in a satisfactory, acceptable, or normal state or condition
a sum of money imposed as a penalty for an offense
examples: This restaurant serves fine dining cuisine every evening
She has fine taste in art and music
The sand on this beach is incredibly fine and soft
Use a fine mesh strainer to remove the seeds
I'm feeling fine after yesterday's minor surgery
The weather is fine for our outdoor picnic
He paid a fine for parking in the wrong spot
The company received a large fine for safety violations

definitions: relating to the central government of a country rather than local governments
relating to a system where states unite under a central authority
examples: Federal law supersedes state law in constitutional matters
She works for a federal agency in Washington DC
The federal system allows states some autonomous powers
Switzerland has a federal structure with different cantons

definitions: giving pleasure or satisfaction through being agreeable or delightful
pleasant in manner showing kindness and consideration for others
requiring careful thought, attention, or precision in handling
examples: We had a nice time at the beach yesterday
What nice weather we're having this spring season
She's such a nice person who helps everyone
It was nice of you to bring flowers
There's a nice distinction between these two similar concepts
This requires nice judgment to handle properly

definitions: better, greater, or otherwise different from what is usual or common
belonging specifically to a particular person, purpose, or situation
having particular importance or significance beyond the ordinary
examples: They prepared a special meal for her birthday celebration
This wine is special, saved for important occasions
She needs special equipment for her medical condition
The school offers special programs for gifted students
Today is a special day in our family's history
You hold a special place in my heart

definitions: very important, serious, or significant in effect or consequence
greater in size, amount, or extent than others of its kind
examples: Climate change is a major concern for future generations
She made a major contribution to scientific research
The company announced major layoffs affecting thousands of employees
There's a major difference between these two approaches

definitions: relating to economics or the economy of a country or region
justified in terms of profitability or providing good value for money
examples: The economic impact of the pandemic was severe worldwide
She studied economic theory at the graduate school level
This car is very economic to run and maintain
It's not economic to repair such an old appliance
